awards.description: THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO DEVELOP THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE TRAINING STAFF, CONDUCTING COMMUNITY OUTREACH, ATTENDING THE REGIONAL TRIBAL OPERATIONS COMMITTEE MEETINGS AND THE TRIBAL/ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY ANNUAL CONFERENCE, DEVELOPING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS SUCH AS A COMMUNITY RESILIENCY PROGRAM, TRIBAL AIR PROGRAM AND A WATER PROGRAM.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $120,840.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE TEJON INDIAN TRIBE TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER MULTI-MEDIA ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $125,000.00. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE MANAGING AN ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT, CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, ATTENDING ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY BUILDING TRAININGS AND MEETINGS, FURTHER DEVELOPING A WATER PROGRAM, AND COMPLETING A GREEN SPACE PILOT PROGRAM. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE SUMMARY REPORTS OF MEETINGS, TRAININGS AND EVENTS, ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH MATERIALS, PROVIDE RESULTS FROM RESEARCH ON WATER PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, AND COMPLETE A GREEN SPACE PILOT PROGRAM WORKSHOP. 

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE MEMBERS AND/OR RESIDENTS OF THE TEJON INDIAN TRIBE.

awards.awarding_agency: Department of Housing and Urban Development
